intro: Cistanthera dewevrei, commonly known as the slender sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in coastal and inland dune environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
